items.title: Enterprise browser startup hits $4.5b valuation in funding
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Island Technology Inc. achieves a $4.5 billion valuation after its latest funding led by Coatue Management.
- The company, based in Texas and Israel, specializes in secure internet browsers for businesses, launching its product in 2022.
- It has raised nearly $500 million from investors such as Sequoia Capital and Insight Partners, previously valued at $3 billion in early 2024.
- Leadership includes CEO Mike Fey (formerly of McAfee) and CTO Dan Amiga (previously at Symantec Corp).
- The company targets enterprises with a focus on security and productivity, serving clients in sectors like hotels, banks, and retailers.

items.title: Trump halts Biden’s $5b EV charging station program
items.summary:
- Trump administration has ordered states to stop spending from the $5 billion NEVI program for EV charging stations.
- The Federal Highway Administration announced the suspension on Feb. 6, with a review of program policies by new leadership.
- All NEVI guidance documents have been rescinded, and state EV deployment plans are on hold until further notice.
- Existing commitments will continue to receive reimbursements, but no new obligations are permitted.
- Nine states had 31 operational NEVI charging stations last year, with 126 public charging ports available.

items.title: Capital SEA: Southeast Asia’s funding landscape
items.summary:
- The article explores the investment landscape in Southeast Asia, focusing on new investors, notable funding rounds, and shifts in investment trends.
- It is divided into two sections: weekly updates on recent investors and macro trends in funding across the region.
- Credit for infographics goes to Yeo Cheng Yong, with editing by Terence Lee.

items.title: Taiwan expands semiconductor ties in Central Europe
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- Taiwan strengthens its semiconductor industry by forging partnerships in Central Europe.
- This initiative is aimed at enhancing technological cooperation and supply chain resilience.
- The collaboration focuses on developing advanced manufacturing and innovation in the semiconductor sector.

items.title: OpenAI to open first Germany office in Munich
items.summary:
- OpenAI plans to open its first office in Germany, starting operations in Munich soon.
- Germany is the largest market for OpenAI in Europe, with the highest number of users, paying subscribers, and developers.
- The decision follows discussions with German officials since 2023, supported by Germany Trade & Invest.
- This aligns with a trend of tech giants like Apple and Google expanding in Germany.
- The Munich office will complement existing locations in Paris, Brussels, and Dublin, underscoring the region’s importance in the AI sector.

items.title: Defense firm Anduril in talks for $2.5b, valued at $28b
items.author: Trae Stephens
items.summary:
- Anduril Industries is in talks to secure US$2.5 billion in funding.
- This funding could value the company at over US$28 billion.
- Led by venture capital firm Founders Fund, this follows a recent US$1.5 billion investment.
- The company is known for developing autonomous weapon systems and plans to invest nearly US$1 billion in a manufacturing facility in Ohio, covering an area similar to 87 football fields.
- No comments were provided by representatives of Anduril or Founders Fund regarding the funding discussions.

items.title: Indian edtech lender raises $2.9m bridge funding
items.author: Varun Chopra, Raheel Shah
items.summary:
- Eduvanz raised 25.52 crore rupee (US$2.9 million) in bridge funding.
- Funding co-led by Juvo Ventures and Capria Fund, with participation from Peak XV Partners and Unitus Ventures.
- Funds will be used for working capital, product development, and marketing.
- 26,405 compulsorily convertible preference shares issued at 9,667 rupee (US$110.12) each on Feb. 1.
- Founded in 2016, Eduvanz provides online education loans, raising nearly US$49 million to date.

items.title: Taiwan’s exports hit $38.71b as tech boom
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Taiwan’s exports grew by 4.4% year-on-year in January, reaching US$38.71 billion.
- This marks the 15th consecutive month of growth and surpasses forecasts of US$35.6 billion to US$36.7 billion.
- Imports fell by 17.2% year-on-year to US$28.74 billion, resulting in a trade surplus of US$9.97 billion, a 317.9% increase from last year.
- Strong demand for AI and high-performance computing has boosted the tech sector.
- China and Hong Kong remain the largest export markets but saw an 11.7% drop to US$10.71 billion.
- The MOF anticipates February exports to be between US$36.5 billion and US$37.7 billion, marking a potential increase of 16-20% year-on-year.

items.title: Coinbase must face New York lawsuit over securities sales
items.summary:
- A US federal judge ruled that Coinbase must face a lawsuit from customers claiming unlawful sales of securities.
- The decision was made by District Judge Paul Engelmayer on February 7.
- The judge rejected Coinbase’s argument of not being a "statutory seller" under federal law.
- The lawsuit includes claims under state laws in California, Florida, and New Jersey.
- The case was initially dismissed in February 2023 but was partially revived in April 2024 by the 2nd US Circuit Court of Appeals.
- Coinbase is also facing legal action from the US SEC regarding unregistered securities trading.

items.title: Meta to lay off 5% of workforce
items.summary:
- Meta Platforms will begin layoffs on Feb. 10, affecting approximately 5% of its workforce.
- Notifications will start at 5 am local time in various regions, including the US, followed by Europe, Asia, and Africa between Feb. 11 and Feb. 18.
- Employees in Germany, France, Italy, and the Netherlands are excluded from the layoffs due to local labor laws.
- The layoffs are referred to as “performance terminations,” focusing on the “lowest performers.”
- The company plans to speed up hiring for key roles like machine learning engineers from Feb. 11 to March 13 to support its 2025 strategy goals.

items.title: Elon Musk says he has no plans to buy TikTok
items.summary:
- Elon Musk clarifies he is not seeking to acquire TikTok and has not made any bid for it.
- He expressed that he does not use TikTok and is unfamiliar with the app's features.
- Musk stated acquiring companies is not typical for him, considering his purchase of Twitter (now X) an exception.
- His comments come amid ongoing scrutiny of TikTok by the US government due to national security concerns.
- US President Donald Trump has previously shown interest in TikTok, with potential decisions on its future expected in February.

items.title: Unsexy but still solves it
items.summary:
- The article emphasizes that most change occurs incrementally, making daunting goals manageable.
- It highlights the value of 'unsexy' solutions that effectively solve real problems, such as fileAI's work with unstructured data, which raised US$14 million.
- Several significant investment deals are reported, including:
  - Cashfree in India raised US$53 million.
  - Bigabid in Israel secured US$25 million.
  - Neusignal Therapeutics in Japan obtained US$14.4 million.
  - fileAI in Singapore raised US$14 million.
  - qeen.ai in Dubai received US$10 million in seed funding.
- Edge, an Indian company, was acquired by Phenom, an AI HR solutions firm, details undisclosed.

items.title: Meet the 50 top-funded startups and tech companies in Korea
items.summary:
- The article lists the 50 Korean tech companies that have raised the most funding from investors.
- Only funding data from the past two years is included in the list.
- The source of the data is Tech in Asia, which provides a comprehensive database of tech companies in Asia.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Korea
items.summary:
- Identifies startups in Korea that are raising funding and becoming significant players.
- Focuses only on companies at the series E stage or earlier.
- Provides key details about each funding round for the companies listed.
- Updated list based on Tech in Asia's data on the latest funding events.

items.title: UK demands Apple backdoor for encrypted cloud data
items.summary:
- The UK government is requesting Apple to create a backdoor for accessing encrypted cloud data.
- This move is part of a broader effort to enhance national security and public safety.
- Concerns about privacy and data security among users and technology experts are being raised in response to the demand.

items.title: Tesla’s China sales drop 11.5% as BYD soars 47%
items.summary:
- Tesla's sales in China dropped by 11.5% in January 2025, selling 63,238 units compared to 71,447 in January 2024.
- BYD, a domestic EV manufacturer, saw a 47% sales increase, delivering 296,446 electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles.
- Tesla has reduced Model Y prices and added financing incentives to remain competitive, planning to launch its full self-driving system in China this year.
- Tesla has not launched a new mass-market model since the Cybertruck in late 2023; an affordable model is expected in early 2025.

items.title: Amazon scales back diversity efforts, focuses on AI
items.summary:
- Amazon has removed references to diversity and inclusion in its 2024 annual report after scaling back several DEI programs.
- Last year’s report highlighted diversity, but the latest focuses on becoming “Earth’s best employer.”
- Public policies streamlined, with DEI mentions condensed and terms like “transgender” removed from the webpage.
- Candi Castleberry, VP of inclusive experiences, announced the discontinuation of outdated DEI programs.
- This change is part of broader industry trends; some firms have cut DEI efforts while others maintain them.
- Amazon plans to invest US$100 billion in AI development by 2025, indicating a strategic shift in focus.

items.title: Delhivery names ex-McKinsey exec as chief business officer
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Delhivery appointed Vani Venkatesh as chief business officer (CBO), effective Feb. 28, 2025.
- Venkatesh will manage transportation businesses, client servicing, and marketing functions.
- She has over 20 years of experience, previously serving at Airtel, McKinsey & Company, and Hindustan Unilever Limited.
- Venkatesh was most recently the chief marketing officer at Airtel until December 2024.
- Delhivery, founded in 2011, is a major logistics provider in India, serving D2C brands and B2B enterprises across 18,600 pin codes.

items.title: DeepSeek boosts China’s smart glasses innovation
items.summary:
- DeepSeek's open-source AI models are enhancing China's smart glasses industry by lowering costs and improving capabilities.
- Developments focus on integrating AI into augmented reality (AR) eyewear.
- Rokid's DeepSeek-R1 is more affordable than OpenAI’s GPT-4.
- Rokid launched AR glasses with large language models in November 2024, featuring real-time translation and navigation.
- Recent developments include limiting AI service access due to high demand and surpassing Doubao as China's fastest-growing AI app with 22.2 million daily active users.

items.title: Ikea-backed Livspace names new CEO, moves HQ to India
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Livspace has appointed co-founder Ramakant Sharma as the new CEO, succeeding Anuj Srivastava, who will become chairman of the board.
- Sharma will manage daily operations while Srivastava will focus on the IPO process and strategic growth.
- Livspace is moving its headquarters from Singapore to India.
- The company has operated since 2014 and has become a unicorn after raising $180 million in a Series F funding round in 2022.
- To date, Livspace has raised over $433.38 million from notable investors including KKR & Co and Ikea.
- This leadership change follows layoffs of over 100 employees in 2023 as part of cost-cutting measures.

items.title: A list of fundraising startups from Asia and beyond (Updated)
Meta, UNESCO expand AI for underrepresented languages
items.summary:
- Meta, in collaboration with UNESCO, has launched the Language Technology Partner Program to improve AI for speech recognition and translation.
- The program focuses on collecting resources for underrepresented languages, aiding AI model development with speech recordings and transcriptions.
- Results will be open source for collaboration with Meta's AI teams, with key participation from Nunavut's government, supporting Inuktut speakers.
- An open-source machine translation benchmark has also been introduced, supporting seven languages, available on Hugging Face.

items.title: Pinterest shares jump 20% on AI ad boost, strong Q1 forecast
items.summary:
- Pinterest shares surged 20% on Feb. 7, following a forecast of Q1 revenue between US$837 million to US$852 million, exceeding analyst expectations.
- Adjusted core earnings projection ranges from US$155 million to US$170 million.
- Growth driven by AI-powered advertising tools, reducing advertiser input by 50% and enhancing competitiveness.
- In Q4, Pinterest reported record revenue of US$1.15 billion due to strong advertising demand across various sectors.
- Stock historical volatility noted, with a 14% drop in November after weak projections but a 21% increase after strong results in April 2024.

items.title: UAE to invest up to $52b in French AI data center
items.summary:
- A UAE fund plans to invest €30 billion to €50 billion (US$31.2 billion to US$52 billion) in a new data center in France.
- The facility will have a one-gigawatt capacity and focus on AI, developed by a consortium of French and Emirati companies.
- This investment follows a strategic AI partnership signed in May 2024 between France and the UAE and will be unveiled at a major investment event later this year.
- The Abu Dhabi-based MGX fund, with assets of US$100 billion, will provide initial financing and is also involved in 'Project Stargate.'
- This initiative aligns with the UAE's strategy to expand its influence through AI and data projects.

items.title: Ex-OpenAI chief scientist’s AI startup seeks $20b: sources
items.author: Ilya Sutskever
items.summary:
- Safe Superintelligence (SSI) is co-founded by Ilya Sutskever and seeks to raise funds at a valuation of at least $20 billion.
- This represents a significant increase from its previous $5 billion valuation during its September funding round where it raised $1 billion.
- Investors in September included Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, and DST Global.
- The fundraising discussions are in early stages with terms being negotiated amid market scrutiny due to competition from lower-cost AI models by DeepSeek.
- SSI, established in June 2024, focuses on developing ‘safe superintelligence’ aligned with human needs, prioritizing long-term progress over commercialization.

items.title: Canada bans DeepSeek chatbot on gov’t devices
items.summary:
- The Canadian federal government has banned the DeepSeek chatbot on government devices due to privacy concerns.
- The ban is a response to the app's collection and retention of sensitive personal data.
- Chief Information Officer Dominic Rochon recommended federal departments limit its use.
- Shared Services Canada has blocked the app on all devices it controls.
- This follows a similar initiative in the US regarding security risks associated with DeepSeek.
- The decision aligns with Canada's earlier move to remove TikTok from government devices over data collection issues.

items.title: SoftBank to invest $40b in OpenAI at $260b valuation: sources
items.summary:
- SoftBank is reportedly finalizing a US$40 billion investment in OpenAI, valuing the company at US$260 billion before funding.
- The investment will be distributed over 12 to 24 months, potentially raising OpenAI’s valuation to US$300 billion.
- SoftBank may syndicate up to US$10 billion, becoming OpenAI’s largest backer, surpassing Microsoft.
- This funding follows SoftBank’s US$3 billion annual commitment to integrate OpenAI’s technology across its subsidiaries.
- Part of the investment is expected to support Stargate, a joint venture aimed at enhancing US AI infrastructure.

items.title: Tokocrypto announces new CEO amid rapid growth
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Tokocrypto appoints Calvin Kizana as new CEO, bringing startup leadership experience.
- Company reports tripling of transaction value and surpassing 4 million users in 2024.
- Offers access to over 380 tokens, staking, dollar-cost averaging, and instant buy/sell options.
- New partnership with blu by BCA Digital to enhance financial solutions.
- Focus on sustainable growth and strengthening Indonesia’s crypto ecosystem.

items.title: EFishery reports 2 execs to police over fraud allegations
items.summary:
- EFishery reported two executives, initials G and C, to Indonesian police for fraud allegations in 2024.
- Allegations filed with Jakarta Metropolitan Police, National Police Criminal Investigation Agency, and Financial Services Authority.
- Significant financial discrepancies found: inflated profit of $16 million, actual loss of $35.4 million, and real revenues of $157 million.
- Claimed 400,000 farming partners; real number is 24,000.
- FTI Consulting appointed to address corporate governance issues amid ongoing investigation.

items.title: Ant International names new chief innovation officer
items.summary:
- Ant International has appointed Jiang-Ming Yang as its chief innovation officer (CIO), effective immediately.
- Yang will lead product and technology teams, focusing on payments, digitalization, and embedded finance.
- Previously served as chief product officer, contributing to several fintech solutions including Alipay+ and Antom.

items.title: Shopee launches platform to help SG sellers go regional
items.summary:
- Shopee has launched the Shopee International Platform (SIP) in Singapore to assist local sellers in expanding into new markets.
- The initiative targets Malaysia and Thailand initially, with future plans for the Philippines.
- Over 8,000 sellers participated in the pilot, resulting in an eightfold increase in orders and gross merchandise value in three months.
- The program offers free cross-border logistics, customer service, and secure payment tools for regional expansion.
- A new feature will give high-performing sellers in Malaysia more control over product selection, pricing, and promotions.
- Shopee plans to onboard more sellers each month via an automated invitation process after the pilot's success.

items.title: Meta’s use of pirated books for AI training exposed
items.summary:
- Recent unsealed emails suggest Meta used pirated books for AI training from shadow libraries.
- At least 81.7 terabytes of data were downloaded, including 35.7 terabytes from Z-Library and LibGen.
- Concerns about legal risks and use of corporate resources for pirated content were raised by an internal engineer in April 2023 and escalated by September.
- Meta allegedly used external servers and “stealth mode” to reduce traceability.
- Authors are seeking more depositions due to inconsistencies in testimonies regarding Mark Zuckerberg's involvement.
- Meta claims its actions fall under “fair use” and challenges authors’ lack of evidence of distribution through torrenting activities.

items.title: Turning Indonesian property into tokens
items.summary:
- Tokenization of properties allows smaller investors to access Indonesian real estate.
- Startups like Goro and D3 Labs are leading this initiative.
- Token holders do not own the properties but share profits due to unclear legal status in Indonesia.

items.title: Meet the 15 top-funded startups and tech companies in Vietnam
Amazon stock falls 4% amid cloud growth concerns
items.summary:
- Amazon’s stock fell 4% on Feb. 7 in Frankfurt due to disappointing cloud computing growth.
- The decline followed a 5% drop in after-hours trading on Feb. 6.
- Investors are worried about lower-than-expected revenue and profit forecasts for Q1 2025, particularly regarding the cloud unit's performance.

items.title: European Central Bank hopes Trump boosts digital euro
items.summary:
- The European Central Bank (ECB) is optimistic that Donald Trump's potential return to office could enhance support for the digital euro initiative.
- ECB aims to leverage the political climate and public interest in digital currencies to promote the digital euro's development.
- Trump’s past statements on cryptocurrencies could impact regulatory perspectives, influencing the ECB’s strategy on digital currency adoption.

items.title: US AI safety institute absent from Paris AI summit: sources
items.summary:
- The AI Safety Institute will not be represented at the global AI summit in Paris on February 10-11, 2025.
- The institute, under the Department of Commerce, currently has no director.
- Vice President JD Vance will lead the U.S. delegation, including representatives from approximately 100 countries.
- Key U.S. attendees confirmed are Lynne Parker from OSTP and Sriram Krishnan, Senior Policy Advisor for AI.

items.title: Oracle unveils new AI tools for financial software platform
items.summary:
- Oracle announced new AI-powered tools for its financial software platform, NetSuite, on Feb. 6.
- The tools simplify routine business tasks, such as generating price quotes for complex purchases.
- A new AI-driven chatbot aids sales professionals and customers in quote generation by gathering information on preferences.

items.title: China, India poised to steer climate talks
items.summary:
- Asia and the rest of the world need to double efforts to combat climate crisis in 2025.
- André Corrêa do Lago from the 2025 UN Climate Change Conference predicts challenges after the US exit from the Paris agreement.
- The US exit allows China and India to take a more prominent role in climate discussions and climate tech markets, projected to be worth $20 billion globally.

items.title: Salesforce, Workday expand global hiring to cut costs
items.summary:
- Salesforce and Workday are increasing international hiring to save costs and invest in AI.
- Salesforce reduced its US workforce from 58% in 2020 to 51% in January 2024, announcing 8,000 layoffs in early 2023 and over 1,000 this week for AI-related roles.
- Workday cut about 1,750 jobs on February 5, focusing on international markets like Costa Rica for cost savings.
- Other tech companies like PayPal and ServiceNow have also reduced US staff significantly, with PayPal shrinking from 53% in 2018 to 38% in 2023.
- Economic pressures and access to skilled labor globally are prompting a reassessment of hiring strategies among tech firms.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Vietnam
items.summary:
- The article lists startups in Vietnam that have recently raised funding, indicating they are on the path to becoming significant businesses.
- It focuses on companies up to the series E funding stage and includes key details about each funding round.
- For more information, links to databases and research methodology are provided, but access to the full article requires a subscription.

items.title: Lyft partners with Amazon, Anthropic for AI customer service
items.summary:
- Lyft has partnered with Amazon and Anthropic to integrate AI into customer support using Anthropic’s Claude AI via Amazon Bedrock.
- The AI system has reduced resolution times by 87% while managing thousands of daily customer inquiries.
- Lyft emphasizes the importance of human support for safety, fraud, and account-related concerns, ensuring that AI does not replace employees.
- The partnership includes AI training for Lyft engineers to create future tools for enhancing rider and driver experiences.

items.title: Israeli tech startup flō Optics secures $35m series A
items.author: Claudio Rottman
items.summary:
- Flō Optics raised US$35 million in series A funding.
- The funds will be used to develop products, scale production, and expand operations.
- Founded in 2019, Flō Optics employs about 60 people and operates in Israel and Switzerland.
- The technology allows for pixel-level precision in lens coatings, improving traditional methods.

items.title: Alibaba appoints AI expert Steven Hoi as VP
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Alibaba Group appoints Steven Hoi Chu-hong as VP to enhance AI team focused on consumer applications.
- Hoi specializes in machine learning and computer vision and previously managed Salesforce Research Asia.
- He will be based in Singapore and work within Alibaba’s Intelligent Information Platform, overseeing consumer-facing AI products such as chatbots and UC Browser.

items.title: Mistral AI launches ‘Le Chat’ mobile chatbot
items.summary:
- Mistral AI has launched 'Le Chat', an open-source generative AI assistant app.
- The app can process up to 1,000 words per second using a fast inference engine.
- Le Chat has several million active users, indicating significant traction.

items.title: Russia’s Sberbank eyes AI partnership with DeepSeek
items.summary:
- Sberbank, Russia’s largest bank, plans to collaborate with Chinese researchers on AI projects led by DeepSeek.
- This initiative follows advancements in AI by China and is part of Russia's strategy to strengthen ties with China and BRICS nations after Western sanctions.
- President Vladimir Putin has urged Sberbank to enhance AI cooperation for better technology access.

items.title: Google introduces digital watermarks for AI-edited images
items.summary:
- Google has launched digital watermarks for images edited using the Magic Editor’s "Reimagine" feature in Google Photos, specifically for Pixel 9 devices.
- This feature enhances transparency about generative AI in photo editing and was released this week.
- The "Reimagine" tool, introduced in 2024, allows significant modifications to images, raising concerns about distinguishing original from AI-modified photos.
- SynthID, developed by Google’s DeepMind division, embeds watermarks in AI-edited images while maintaining their visual integrity. Users can verify existing watermarks as well.
- The technology currently supports beta tests for AI-generated text and video as well.
- Users can find images with watermarks through the "About this Image" metadata in Google Photos, although very minor edits may go undetected.

items.title: Tinder plans AI features to reverse decline in users
items.summary:
- Tinder is set to launch AI-powered features for discovery and matching in the upcoming quarter to address a decline in active users.
- Match Group announced this during the Q4 2024 earnings call, aiming for more personalized matches to enhance user engagement.
- There has been a 10% year-over-year drop in monthly active users as of October, and despite earning US$476 million in Q4 2024, the revenue did not meet expectations.

items.title: AWS’s Q4 revenue up 18.9% amid AI focus
items.summary:
- Amazon Web Services (AWS) grew 18.9% year-over-year to US$28.79 billion in Q4 2024.
- AWS accounted for 15% of Amazon’s total revenue and more than half of its operating profit.
- Operating income increased by 48% to US$10.63 billion, exceeding forecasts of US$10.45 billion.
- AWS focused on AI, particularly with custom chips for AI models used by Apple.
- Notable upcoming events include the unveiling of AI-enhanced Alexa on Feb. 26, 2025, and plans to cut 15% of middle management by Q1 2025.

items.title: OpenAI rethinks strategy after DeepSeek’s open-source AI
items.summary:
- OpenAI is reassessing its product strategies following the launch of DeepSeek’s open source AI model R1.
- CEO Sam Altman finds the competition “invigorating” and plans to release more advanced AI systems soon.
- The company is increasing transparency and re-evaluating open-source policies, recognizing past missteps.
- DeepSeek’s model provides greater flexibility for developers compared to OpenAI’s previous closed model.
- Investment in AI infrastructure remains a key focus, with OpenAI continuing a US$500 billion project with SoftBank and Oracle.
